name: Linux - Network Diagnostics
description:
This runbook is intended to provide steps with automations each doing some basic network diagnostic steps on/from the targeted system. 
Automations provided by this runbook can be used in your own runbook as well.

steps.description:
Have a closer look to the network interfaces of the specified target system TARGET

Get Network Interfaces

Get the default routing table on the specified target system:  TARGET

Get standard Network Routing Tables

In the first step we check that the specified destination DESTINATION can be reached by the specified target system TARGET via a standard PING command.

 

Check Network Connection

 

The "Ping statistics" section shows average numbers created by the probes done by the for the ping process. It is displayed the number of packets sent and received. You see number and percentage of packets that were lost. In case that any packets are lost, you seem to have a network connection problem.

In the "Approximate round trip times" section you get an overview of your connection speed.
A higher number here has to be seen as a slower connection to the destination.

In this step a more detailed check is done to reach the specified destination
DESTINATION from the target system TARGET

 

Route Network Path
